info.description:
CREALOGIX Digital Banking Hub: Asset Account API

**Accounts-API** offers access to account data and transactions.
Information regarding creditcards are *NOT* part of this API. Those will be found in a specific **Creditcards-API**.
# HTTP Headers #
The __X-Correlation-Id__ header is not any more part of this specification. The header still exists but is handled by a specific node (e.g Gateway) of the runtime environment. 
# Paging #
If the result of request is a list, it may be split in pages using the __size__ parameter.
In this case the result provides the standard HAL page __resource links__ (__first__, __last__, __next__, __previous__ and __self__). A __page meta data__ summary (__page number__, __page size__, __total number of pages__ and __total number of items__) is also provided.
# Tenant ID #
The tenant identifier should be a human readable string. For Crealogix could be CLXN. This identifier should be mapped internally by the implementation if required.


# Accounts - general entry points #
As Entrypoint or for unspecific queries a request to `/accounts`-URL delivers a list of all accounts accessible by the authorized contract. `/accounts` returns metadata (such as account number, alias) for each account as well as HAL-Links with URLs to more detailled APIs, see below.

With `/transactions` also an unspecific request for all transactions of all accessible accounts can be placed.
# Account - specific requests #
Instead of requesting list of all available accounts, a specific account can be accessed by using the *accountId* of this account. Please be aware, that all Ids are session specific and will change from one session to the other (for details see general API concepts documentation).
With a specific *accountId* the following endpoints are available

 - `/accounts/{accountId}` delivering metadata of the specific account

 - `/accounts/{accountId}/balance` presenting the balance and available amount for the specific account

 - `/accounts/{accountId}/permissions` presenting allowed actions for the authorized contract

 - `/accounts/{accountId}/transactions` presenting account transactions (further detail below)

 - `/transactions/{transactionId}` presenting a transaction (further detail below)

 ## Technical Notes ##

 Due to some limitation of the swagger language the representation of balance and permission is not complete every where.

 The balance and the permissions are part of the account object, but may be also retrieved separately.

 As part of the account object balance and permission doesn't show any navigation link. 
 The single permission set shows the link to the contract, since every set may depend from a different contract.

 A call to the balance/permissions page instead shows all navigation links.

 Swagger doesn't support two different views of the same object at the same time. The consequence is that the definition of the balance and permission pages do not have the ___link__ property, which __must__ however be present in the implementation.

# Transactions #
Using `/transactions/camt` all visible transactions may be retrieved as CAMT documents, grouped by account.
With `/accounts/{accountid}/transactions/camt` visible transactions of an account can be accessed as CAMT document(s).
Range of transaction can be limited by query parameters.
## Transaction Balance Groups ##
The transactions must be grouped by day providing a daily balance. The daily balance may be expressed in any supported  currency, but the implementor (server side) must remember to properly convert any transaction expressed in a different  currency.
# Optional Features #
Optional features aren't mandatory, the product implementing this specification may obmit the implementation. 
* The optional features group together functions that aim to improve the presentation of bank data.
* The features proposed allow the end user to add a personal touch to the presentation layer.
## Account Name ##
This feature allows the end user to change the bank standard account label.  A full implementation requires an additional persistence field.
## Account Image ## 
This feature allows the end user to add a small image to the account.  This Avatar should help to better visualize the purpose of the account.

The implementation should limit the dimension of the upload.
info.title: Asset Account API

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: Tenant identifier

post.summary: Gets all accounts that matches the filters, sorted and paged as required.
post.description:
* Retrieves a sorted list of accounts the current user is alloewd to see. 
* The list is divided into pages according to parameters or default.
* The list is sorted according to the information provided.  Fields are prioritized according to the order in which they are provided

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The number of accounts per page.

requestBody.description: Extended search parameter and sort ordering

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: Tenant identifier

get.summary: Gets a single account using the internal identifier.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The implementation internal identifier, session based

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: Tenant identifier

delete.summary: Restores the default label for the account name.
delete.description:
* This is an optional feature that may be implemented by the provider.
* The user defined label for the account name should be replaced by the original one given by the bank.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The implementation internal identifier, session based

post.summary: Creates a new customer defined label for account name.
post.description:
* This is an optional feature that may be implemented by the provider.
* The label for the account name defined by the bank is replaced by the one defined by the customer.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The implementation internal identifier, session based

put.summary: Replaces the customer defined label for account name.
put.description:
* This is an optional feature that may be implemented by the provider.
* The label for the account name replaced by a new one defined by the customer.

post.summary: Gets all sorted transaction of the account grouped by day.
post.description:
# List of account movements (simple) #
Delivers account movements for a specific account based on accountId and further criteria. By default last 30 days are taken into consideration for result. Movements are grouped by days and returned with daily balance (`transactionGroups`).
>*This request is limited to avoid transfer of personal data. For more detailled search request the `POST`-request should be used.*
## Query parameter ##
### page ###
Query parameter page can be used to navigate to specific pages, when original response did contain more then one page (depends on page size).
### size ###
When a disctinct page size is desired, it can be specified here. be aware that large page sizes might impact performance. By default page size is set to 10.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The number of items per page.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The implementation internal identifier, session based

requestBody.description: technical id of specific account, session based

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: Tenant identifier

get.description:
## Supported Documents ##
CAMT.052 Bank-to-Customer Account Report
CAMT.053 Bank-to-Customer Statement
CAMT.054 Bank-to-Customer Debt/Credit Notification
## Behaviour ##
Returns the CAMT document relating to the requested account if the uses has the access rights.
OAUTH2 authorization is required.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The implementation internal identifier, session based

parameters.name: isoType
parameters.description: XML export type (default CAMT053)

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Transactions starting from booking date (RFC 3339 YYYY-MM-TT format)

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: transactions until booking date (RFC 3339 YYYY-MM-TT format). If not specified, today is the default value.

parameters.name: camtDetailType
parameters.description: WDETAIL - with D-Level Transactions (Default); WODETAIL - without D-Level Transactions

200.description: Zipped file include one or many camt.052, camt.053 or camt.054 documents (files). This is name-pattern for the files IsoType_IBAN-Nr.xml (e. g. CAMT053_DE60280501000123456789.xml)

204.description: No transactions for this request parameters found. No content in response body.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: Tenant identifier

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: The implementation internal identifier, session based.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: Tenant identifier

get.description: Returns transactions for accounts accessible by the user as CAMT-files. OAUTH2 authorization is required.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
Possibility to specify one or more accounts. If there is no account specified, transactions of all accounts accessible by the user will be returned.
Returns a ZIP archive containing the CAMT document.

parameters.name: isoType
parameters.description: export type (default CAMT053)

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Transactions starting from booking date (RFC 3339 YYYY-MM-TT format)

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: transactions until booking date (RFC 3339 YYYY-MM-TT format). If not specified, today is the default value.

parameters.name: camtDetailType
parameters.description: WDETAIL - with D-Level Transactions (Default); WODETAIL - without D-Level Transactions

200.description: Zipped file include one or many camt.052, camt.053 or camt.054 documents (files). For each account there is one XML file. This is name-pattern for the files IsoType_IBAN-Nr.xml (e. g. CAMT053_DE60280501000123456789.xml)

204.description: No transactions for this request parameters found. No content in response body

TransactionSearchDto.description:
Request body for searching transactions supporting sorting and criteria

 ### startDate ###

  This parameter defines the start booking date, that is used to filter
  results. In this way resultset can be limited.

  > *Hint: Should be used with `endDate`*

  ### endDate ###

  This parameter defines the last booking date of the desired resultset.

  > *Hint: `endDate` should not be used without `startDate`.*

  ### transactionFlow ###

  This parameter defines the direction of transactions.

  Following values are available:

  - INCOMING (incoming payments)

  - OUTGOING (outgoing payments)

  - BOTH (all payments)


  Is no value defined explictly, the default `BOTH` is taken into account.

  ### transactionType ###

  This parameter defines, whether only booked, unbooked or both types of
  transactions are selected for report.

  Following values are available:

  - BOOKED

  - UNBOOKED

  - BOTH


  Is no value defined explictly, the default `BOTH` is applied.

TransactionCriteriaDto.description: filter object used to search for transactions by given criteria

startDate.description: transactions from a booking date RFC 3339 YYYY-MM-TT format)

endDate.description:
transactions until booking date (RFC 3339 YYYY-MM-TT format). If not
            specified, today is the default value.

amountFrom.description: transactions having an amount of equals or biggern than amountFrom

amountTo.description: transactions having an amount of equals of smaller than amountTo

AccountSearchDto.description: Request body for searching accounts supporting sorting and different criteria

AccountOrderByFieldDto.description: Object composed of sort order and particualr field to order results by

AccountOrderableFieldType.description: Enum defining by which fields Accounts can be ordered by

AccountCriteriaDto.description: Filter object used to search for accounts by defined criteria

accountName.description: Alias of the account, the customer may want to change it.

accountNumber.description: The product number or account number.

portfolioId.description: unique identifier of the related portfolio.

contractId.description: The unique identifier of the related contract.

AccountDto.description:
Account object.
* accountType - Type of the account, not all types might be supported by specific banks.
* balance - Information about the current value of the account.
* bank - The bank that manages the account.
* currency - The account default currency.
* permissions - All permissions the current user have on the account.

accountName.description: Alias of the account, the customer may want to change it.

accountNumber.description: The product number or account number.

defaultDebtAccount.description: True if this is the default debt account for payments, otherwise false.

description.description: Description or purpose of the account.

formattedAccountNumber.description: The formatted product number or formatted account number.

overdraftLimit.description: the overdraft limit granted for the specific amount

AccountBalanceDto.description:
* availableAmount, is the amount available for withdraw or transfer.
* balance, is the current value of the account.

valutaDate.description: Valuta date of the transaction (RFC 3339 YYYY-MM-TT format)

bookingDate.description: Booking date of the transaction (ISO 3339 YYYY-MM-TT format)

end2endID.description: ID defined by initiator of transaction, format '([A-Za-z0-9]|[+|\?|/|\-|:|\(|\)|\.|,|'|\p{Zs}])*'

referenceNumber.description: structured reference number (e.g. SEPA mandat reference)

bookingText.description: Booking text as provided by bank

alias.description: Alias of the account for the coresponding contract

AccountType.description: type of the account, not all types might be supported by specific banks

TransactionOrderByFieldDto.description: Object composed of sort order and particular field to order results by

TransactionOrderableFieldDto.description: Enum defining by which fields Transactions can be ordered by

bic.description: Code allocated to a financial or non-financial institution by the ISO 9362 Registration Authority, as described in ISO 9362 "Banking - Banking telecommunication messages - Business identifier code (BIC)".

institutionId.description: Unique and unambiguous identifier of a clearing system member, assigned by the system or system administrator (e.g. BC, BLZ).

CamtDetailType.description: WDETAIL - with D-Level Transactions (Default); WODETAIL - without D-Level Transactions

TransactionBalanceGroupDto.description: Group of transactions of a day for daily balance

date.description: Date of the grouped transactions (RFC 3339 YYYY-MM-TT format)

_timestamp.description: The exact date and time when the response was received, ISO 8601 date and time.

_status.description: Shows if the message was successful or contains errors. This is mostly helpful for early processing by javascript clients. Status depends also on HTTP-Status codes (HTTP-Code != 2xx = false).

StatusMessageDto.description: Common response message object (Optional for success messages).

path.description:
* JSON path for field validation. If not set, the message is a global message. If this field is set the text contains the field specific message.
* Elements of the JSON-structure will be separated by "." and arrays will be represented with [].

StatusMessageCategoryType.description: Category, which defines the severity of the message.
